div.l: And sum tyme lad with Reuell to Newgate
And at the laste laste his maister hym be thought "laste" added in left margin.
Vpon a day whanne his paper sought
Of a prouerbe that seithe this same worde
Welle bettir is a roten appill oute of horde
Thanne hit rote all the remenaunt
So farith hit bi a riotous seruaunt
Hit is lasse harme tolete hym parte ⁊and trye his gre⁊and trye his gre
Thanne he schende alle the seruᵃauntis in a place
Ther for his maister yaue hym acquitaunce
And bad hym go with sorwe and myschaunce
And thus this iolif prentice had his leue
Nowe late hym riote alle the nyght or leue
And for ther is no thef withoute a louke
That he helpith hym to wast and to souke
Of that he bribe kan or borwebrweborwe may
A non he sente his bed and his aray
Vnto his compere of his own sorte
That louyd dise and reuel and disporte
And had a wif that held for cuntenaunce
A schop and swiue for hir coisutenaunce sustinaunce coisutenaunce sustinaunce

l.seg: NOw lithe and lystenyth so god geue you goode fyne
And ye schulle here gode game of yonge Gamelyne
xxiiij an yongemen that helde hem ful bolde

div.l: Lith and lestenyth and herkenyth a right
And ye schullen here of a doughty knyght
Sir Iohn of Bovndes was his name
He koude of norture and moche of game
Thre sonnes the knyght hadde and with his body he he wan
The Eldest was a moche schrewe and sone be ganne
